attributes.action: Direct all payroll companies to refund all  deductions made on staff salaries
attributes.background: Some Umbrella Companies make deductions called Company Margin or Admin fee on staff gross income. These costs are not to be deducted from staff salaries. The contracting companies should pay for the services rendered to them by the Umbrella Companies. It is their obligation and not the staff's.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

There are already guidelines as to when an employer can make deductions from pay. We're not sure exactly what further action you'd like the Government or Parliament to take. 

You can find out more about the guidelines here:

https://www.gov.uk/understanding-your-pay/deductions-from-your-pay

You could start a new petition asking for a specific change to these guidelines, if that's something you'd like to see happen.
